description: Canadian National CAD Standard (PSPC-based) callout detection prompts

detail.name: Detail Callout
detail.text_prompt: A circular callout symbol with a thin black outline and white or light fill. Contains a number (1-99), or number with sheet reference separated by slash or horizontal dividing line (3/A5, 1/A6). The circle is clean and distinct with NO triangles or other attachments. Text is centered and uses construction drawing font. Sheet references use simple format: single letter followed by 1-2 digits (A5, B2, X2). Circle diameter typically 0.3-0.8 inches on construction documents. Canadian standard typically avoids letter-only labels to reduce false positives.
visual_characteristics: Perfect circular outline
No triangles or attachments
Primarily numbers (1-99), avoid letter-only
May have horizontal dividing line
Sheet reference format: letter+digit (A5, B2, X2)
false_positives_to_exclude: Circles with only words (3+ consecutive letters)
Single letters that could be grid markers: O, C, D, S, I, L, T, X, V, U, P, R, H, J
Text like NORTH, SCALE, NOTE, DETAIL, VERIFY

elevation.name: Elevation Callout
elevation.text_prompt: A circular callout symbol with EXACTLY ONE solid black triangle attached to the circle's edge, pointing in the viewing direction. Circle has thin black outline with white fill, divided horizontally by a line. Contains a number (1-99) or single letter from restricted set (A, B, E, F, G, K, M, N, Q, W, Y, Z - excluding high false-positive letters) above the dividing line, with optional sheet reference below in format '2/X2'. Triangle points outward (up, down, left, or right) indicating the direction from which the elevation is viewed. Circle diameter typically 0.3-0.8 inches. Format examples: '2/X2', '1/A5'. Sheet references use simple Canadian format: letter+digit (A5, X2, B5). Based on Canadian PSPC standard.
visual_characteristics: Circular outline with horizontal dividing line
EXACTLY ONE solid black triangle attached to circle edge
Triangle points in viewing direction (up/down/left/right)
Number or approved letter above line, sheet ref below
One triangle distinguishes from section (which has two)
Avoid high-confusion letters (O, C, D, S, I, L, T, X, V, U, P, R, H, J)
false_positives_to_exclude: Letters likely to be text: O, C, D, S, I, L, T, X, V, U, P, R, H, J

section.name: Section Callout
section.text_prompt: A circular callout symbol with EXACTLY TWO solid black triangles attached to the circle's edge. Triangles are positioned either top+bottom OR left+right to indicate the section cut line direction. Circle has thin black outline, white fill, and horizontal dividing line. Contains a letter from approved set (A, B, E, F, G, K, M, N, Q, W, Y, Z - typically A, B, C, etc.) above the line, with optional sheet reference below in format 'A/X2'. The two triangles show both sides of the section cut plane. Circle diameter typically 0.3-0.8 inches. Format examples: 'A/X2', 'B/A5'. Sheet references use simple Canadian format: letter+digit. Based on Canadian PSPC standard.
visual_characteristics: Circular outline with horizontal dividing line
EXACTLY TWO solid black triangles attached
Triangles positioned top+bottom OR left+right
Letter (typically A, B, C, etc.) above line, sheet ref below
Two triangles distinguish from elevation (which has one)
Approved letters only: A, B, E, F, G, K, M, N, Q, W, Y, Z
false_positives_to_exclude: High-confusion letters: O, C, D, S, I, L, T, X, V, U, P, R, H, J

title.name: Title Callout
title.text_prompt: A small circular callout symbol appearing at the bottom or corner of an enlarged detail drawing box. Circle has thin black outline with white fill, contains a reference number (1-99) or letter (A-Z) that corresponds to a detail callout elsewhere on the sheet. Often accompanied by text labels such as detail name, scale information (SCALE: 1:50, 1:20), or drawing title. Positioned within or immediately below detail drawing boundary boxes rather than on the main plan view. Circle diameter typically 0.25-0.5 inches, slightly smaller than detail callouts on main plan. Canadian drawings typically use metric scale notation.
visual_characteristics: Small circular outline
Located at bottom/corner of detail drawing boxes
Contains reference number or letter matching detail callout
Usually near text labels (detail name, scale in metric)
Smaller than typical plan callouts (0.25-0.5 inches)
false_positives_to_exclude: Detail callouts on main plan view

exclude_rules: Any circle containing only words with 3+ consecutive letters
Circles with dimension text (measurements with fractions or units like 50mm, 1.5m)
Grid reference markers (single letters along grid lines)
Circles without clear geometric precision (freehand drawn)
High-confusion single letters in any context: O, C, D, S, I, L, T, X, V, U, P, R, H, J

sheet_reference_format.description: Simple format with single letter followed by 1-2 digits

letter_filtering.exclusion_reason: High false-positive rate - commonly confused with words, dimensions, or grid markers
